verses.verse: There <S%H3426>is<s%> a <S%H7451>evil<s%> which I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>, and it is <S%H7227>common<s%> among <S%H120>men<s%>:

A <S%H376>man<s%> to whom <S%H430>God<s%> has <S%H5414>given<s%> <S%H6239>riches<s%>, <S%H5233>wealth<s%>, and <S%H3519>honor<s%>, so that he <S%H2638>wants<s%> nothing for his <S%H5315>soul<s%> of all that he <S%H183>desires<s%>, yet <S%H430>God<s%> gives him not <S%H7980>power<s%> to <S%H398>eat<s%> of <S%H376>it<s%>, but a stranger <S%H398>eats<s%> <S%H1892>it<s%>: this is vanity, and it is a <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H2483>disease<s%>.

If a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H3205>fathered<s%> a <S%H3967>hundred<s%> <S%H2421>sons<s%>, and lived <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>, so that the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H8141>years<s%> be <S%H7227>many<s%>, and his <S%H5315>soul<s%> be not <S%H7646>filled<s%> with <S%H2896>good<s%>, and also that he have no <S%H6900>burial<s%>; I <S%H559>say<s%>, that a untimely <S%H5309>birth<s%> is better than <S%H2896>he<s%>.
For he <S%H935>comes<s%> in with <S%H1892>vanity<s%>, and <S%H3212>departs<s%> in <S%H2822>darkness<s%>, and his <S%H8034>name<s%> shall be <S%H3680>covered<s%> with <S%H2822>darkness<s%>.
Moreover he has not <S%H7200>seen<s%> the <S%H8121>sun<s%>, nor <S%H3045>known<s%> any <S%H2088>thing<s%>: this has more <S%H5183>rest<s%> than the <S%H2088>other<s%>.

<S%H432>Yes<s%>, though he <S%H2421>live<s%> a <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> <S%H6471>twice<s%> <S%H7200>told<s%>, yet has he seen no <S%H2896>good<s%>: do not all <S%H1980>go<s%> to <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H4725>place<s%>?
All the <S%H5999>labor<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> is for his <S%H6310>mouth<s%>, and yet the <S%H5315>appetite<s%> is not <S%H4390>filled<s%>.
For what has the <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H3148>more<s%> than the <S%H3684>fool<s%>? what has the <S%H6041>poor<s%>, that <S%H3045>knows<s%> to <S%H1980>walk<s%> before the <S%H2416>living<s%>?

<S%H2896>Better<s%> is the <S%H4758>sight<s%> of the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> than the <S%H1980>wandering<s%> of the <S%H5315>desire<s%>: this is also <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and <S%H7469>vexation<s%> of <S%H7307>spirit<s%>.

That which has been is <S%H7121>named<s%> <S%H3528>already<s%>, and it is <S%H3045>known<s%> that it is <S%H120>man<s%>: neither <S%H3201>may<s%> he <S%H1777>contend<s%> with him that is mightier than <S%H8623>he<s%>.
Seeing there <S%H3426>be<s%> <S%H7235>many<s%> <S%H1697>things<s%> that <S%H7235>increase<s%> <S%H1892>vanity<s%>, what is <S%H120>man<s%> the <S%H3148>better<s%>?

For who <S%H3045>knows<s%> what is <S%H2896>good<s%> for <S%H120>man<s%> in this <S%H2416>life<s%>, <S%H4557>all<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H1892>vain<s%> <S%H2416>life<s%> which he <S%H6213>spends<s%> as a <S%H6738>shadow<s%>? for who can <S%H5046>tell<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> what shall be <S%H310>after<s%> him under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>?
